title: Chargers playoff picture: Who LA would face if season ended today
description: The Chargers defeated the Chiefs on Sunday, nearly securing a playoff spot. So who would they face if the season ended today?
fullText:
The Chargers defeated the Chiefs on Sunday afternoon, knocking Kansas City out of playoff contention. So, how much did it increase their chances of making the playoffs?

Here's a look at how Los Angeles' win over Kansas City impacts its playoff chances.

Sitting at 10-4 going after the win, the Chargers have a 95% chance of making the postseason, according to The Athletic's Playoff Simulator. They entered Week 15 with a 78% chance.

The Chargers will face the NFL's 6th-hardest schedule the remainder of the season, per Tankathon. They have two matchups remaining against teams with winning records (Broncos and Texans), as well as the Cowboys.

Below is a look at Los Angeles' remaining opponents:

The Chargers entered Week 15 in second place in the standings. They remain there and are still two games back from first place in the division.

Denver Broncos (12-2; AFC West leaders)

New England Patriots (11-3; AFC East leaders)

Jacksonville Jaguars (10-4; AFC South leaders)

Pittsburgh Steelers (7-6; AFC North leaders)

Los Angeles Chargers (10-4; wild card No. 1)

Buffalo Bills (10-4; wild card No. 2)

Houston Texans (9-5; wild card No. 3)

If the season ended today, the Chargers would travel to Pittsburgh to face the Steelers.

This article originally appeared on Chargers Wire: Chargers' playoff odds, remaining schedule, division standings

title: Chiefs vs. Chargers: Mahomes scrambles for KC's first score in Week 15
description: Take a look at this video of Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes' outstanding touchdown run against the Chargers in Week 15.
fullText:
The Kansas City Chiefs were quick to score on their first drive against the Los Angeles Chargers on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium.

After losing the coin toss, the Chiefs received the opening kickoff and marched down the field with the help of masterful play from quarterback Patrick Mahomes and his numerous weapons.

On an 11-play, 68-yard drive, the two-time MVP utilized his impressive scrambling ability to find the end zone and notch Kansas City's first score of the day.

Take a look at this video of Mahomes' outstanding rushing touchdown, which was posted to Twitter by the Chiefs' official account:

title: Chiefs-Chargers: 5 things to watch in Week 15 contest
description: Here are the key factors in the pivotal matchup between Kansas City and Los Angeles.
fullText:
On Sunday, the (6-7) Kansas City Chiefs will take on the division rival (9-4) Los Angeles Chargers in an AFC West showdown on Sunday at Arrowhead Stadium. The game will kick off at noon Arrowhead Time and will be broadcast on CBS ‚Äî locally on KCTV5.

This game will be a rematch of the season opener, in which the Chargers won 27-21 in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. Los Angeles has put together a strong season since, and is currently the top Wild Card team in the AFC playoff race. The Chiefs are on the outside looking in, and this season has been a major disappointment for the defending conference champions.

Temperatures at kickoff are expected to be frigid. Since 2010, the Chiefs are 5-3 against the Chargers in December at Arrowhead.

Last week, left tackle Esa Pole made his NFL debut after Wanya Morris left the game early with a knee injury. Both Morris and right tackle Jawaan Taylor have been declared out for this game, so Pole is slated to start again.

This is a golden opportunity for the undrafted rookie ‚Äî who turned in a solid performance in his debut ‚Äî to continue to make a case for a roster spot in 2026. Morris is slated to be a free agent, while Taylor could be a cap casualty. So if he plays well enough, Pole has a chance to compete for a starting job or a shot at being the team‚Äôs new swing tackle.

Similar to the Houston Texans, Los Angeles has a solid pass rush featuring veteran outside linebacker Khalil Mack and rising star Tuli Tuipulotu off the edge. But unlike the Texans, the Chargers‚Äô pass rush relies on power, which will give Pole a new set of obstacles to overcome. If he turns in another solid performance, it will be worth keeping him on the field through the end of the season.

Third downs will be critical this week. Los Angeles‚Äô offense converts at a 47% rate, the third-highest in the NFL, while the Chiefs rank 13th at 40%. Defensively, the Chargers allow the fourth-lowest percentage of third-down conversions (34%), while Kansas City ranks 26th at 43%.

The Chiefs‚Äô struggles to defend third down were apparent last week. The defense allowed eight conversions over 18 attempts against Houston ‚Äî and the week prior, nine of 16 third downs against the Dallas Cowboys.

The Chiefs‚Äô issues on third-down defense stem from the inability to create pressure in passing situations. That started in Week 1, when Los Angeles converted seven of 13 third downs.

The Chargers rank second in the NFL in time of possession per game, averaging 32:56 per game. Los Angeles excels at keeping teams off balance on early downs, while setting up manageable third downs where the powerful run game helps move the sticks.

This presents a layered problem for Kansas City‚Äôs defense that has been one of the least effective units under Chiefs‚Äô defensive coordinator Steve Spagnuolo.

This could be one of the lower-scoring games in the recent history of this rivalry. According to FanDuel Sportsbook, the Over/Under is listed at only 41.5 points ‚Äî and the very cold weather expected on Sunday could also be a factor.

Both teams rank among the top 10 in points allowed per game: Kansas City surrenders 19.4 points per game, while the Chargers allow 20.8 points per contest.

Each franchise ranks in the upper third of the league in points scored per game, but both have serious offensive line issues that could hinder the strategy. The Chiefs‚Äô game plan in Week 14 was boosted by a backup-heavy offensive line, and Los Angeles has had its own struggles protecting quarterback Justin Herbert.

To win this game, Kansas City needs bounce-back performances from its top two pass-catchers after a horrible game in Week 14. Rice caught only four catches for 34 yards, while Kelce had one catch for eight. Both players dropped passes at key times; one resulted in a turnover on downs, and the other ended as an interception.

It was an embarrassing effort by the two players who directly contributed to the loss. The Chiefs have a higher standard for both.

Neither player spoke to the media after the game; it appeared frustrations from this long season had boiled over. Leadership is desperately needed for this team right now, and it starts at the top. Anything can happen in the NFL, but if the Chiefs want to even imagine making the playoffs, then they need all-out efforts from Kelce and Rice on Sunday.

Due to injuries on the Chargers‚Äô offensive line, Herbert has been one of the most hit and pressured quarterbacks in the NFL this season. He is the third-most sacked quarterback ‚Äî having taken 45 this year ‚Äî and has taken the second most hits (61) on the season.

The beating has taken its toll, and Herbert is playing with a broken left hand, which has limited what the Chargers can do offensively. The Chiefs‚Äô pass rush has struggled to generate pressure this season, but getting after Herbert will be a key to Sunday‚Äôs game.

title: Chiefs fans can win big with annual event at Joplin furniture store
description: A popular annual promotion returns ‚Äî giving you a chance at free furniture for Christmas.
fullText:
JOPLIN, Mo. ‚Äî A popular annual promotion returns ‚Äî giving you a chance at free furniture for Christmas.

Joplin‚Äôs Wayside Furniture is bringing back its 12 days of Christmas for customers who buy furniture between tomorrow and noon Christmas Eve.

It‚Äôs simple: if the Chiefs beat the Denver Broncos by 18 points or more during their Christmas game, customers get their money back ‚Äì except for sales tax.

The 12 days of Christmas deal has been a hit for 5 years now, especially since last year when the Chiefs finally made it happen, by beating the Pittsburg Steelers by 19 points.

title: Apollo Awards $23.5 Million of Bonuses to Finance, Legal Chiefs
description: Apollo Global Management Inc. is giving its finance chief and top lawyer retention bonuses totaling $23.5 million.
fullText: IndustriesBy Laura BenitezSaveApollo Global Management Inc. is giving its finance chief and top lawyer retention bonuses totaling $23.5 million.Chief Financial Officer Martin Kelly and Chief Legal Officer Whitney Chatterjee will receive restricted share units worth $10 million and $13.5 million, respectively, according to a regulatory filing Friday. The awards will be granted Dec. 18.
